title: Chess Valley Circular Walk Route

images.title: Nigel Cox / Chorleywood Common: Artichoke Dell
images.caption: Chorleywood Common: Artichoke Dell. Viewed looking westwards over Dog Kennel Lane towards Artichoke Dell. The white building is the Black Horse Public House.

images.title: Graham Hale / Chorleywood House and part of  Chorleywood House Estate
images.caption: Chorleywood House Estate. Part of the 170-acre estate.

images.title: Nigel Cox / River Chess, near Sarratt Bottom
images.caption: River Chess, near Sarratt Bottom. Viewed looking upstream and northwards, the river here appears to be in an artificial cut, as it does not flow in the lowest part of the valley, which is to the left of the photo.

images.title: Cathy Cox / A Pastoral Scene
images.caption: A Pastoral Scene. Looking south east towards North Hill, Chorleywood, this idyllic picture of rural tranquillity was marred by the constant roar of the traffic on the M25 motorway, about a kilometre away to the south east.

images.title: Nigel Cox / River Chess, near Valley Farm
images.caption: River Chess, near Valley Farm. Viewed looking downstream and eastwards from the footbridge by the Holloway Lane ford, the commercial watercress beds are beyond the shed, with the trees on the slope of Mount Wood visible to the right.

images.title: Nigel Cox / Chenies
images.caption: Chenies. Viewed looking westwards across the village green. The village pump is visible to the left of the old style road sign, and the house in the distance has a plaque indicating that it was built in 1857.

images.title: Nigel Cox / Latimer: Great Water
images.caption: Latimer: Great Water. The artificial lake in the grounds of Latimer Park viewed looking eastwards from the Latimer Park Farm bridge. The channel of the River Chess is beyond the grass to the right.

images.title: David Hawgood / Carpenter's Wood, Chorleywood
images.caption: Carpenter's Wood, Chorleywood. Looking north on the Chiltern Way

description: This route uses a section of the Chess Valley Walk and other public footpaths to create a circular walk through the area. On the way there's nice river trails, woodland paths and country views to enjoy. The walk starts from the tube station at Chorleywood on the Metropolitan line of the London Underground. From here you can pick up the Chess Valley Walk and follow it north east through Chorleywood Common to the Chorleywood House Estate . There's some lovely grounds here with ponds, gardens, sculptures and woodland to explore. After passing the house you soon arrive at the River Chess where you follow the river path north west to Sarratt Bottom and Latimer . Here you cross the river and head east through woodland to Chenies where there's a splendid manor house and grounds. After exploring the house you head south along the Chiltern Heritage Trail and the Chiltern Way to Halsey's Wood and Carpenter's Wood where you turn south east. Shortly after passing through the wood you arrive back at Chorleywood station.
